original: sdug bsngal gsum gyi @185b zhes pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal 'khor can phung po de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum gyi @185b zhes pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal 'khor can phung po de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The aggregates that are associated with the three kinds of suffering, such as the suffering of suffering, are threefold.

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ni dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dud 'gro'i 'gro bar song ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal ni dmyal ba dang yi dags dang dud 'gro'i 'gro bar song ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: The suffering of suffering is that of those who have gone to the destinies of hell beings, hungry ghosts, and animals.üîΩThe suffering of change is that of the gods and humans, because they are separated from happiness.

original: mngon du byas pa sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ste /üîΩde yang phal cher mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: mngon du byas pa sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ste /üîΩde yang phal cher mi'i 'gro bar gtogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The suffering of the formative forces is that of those who have been reborn in the desire realm, because they are not separated from the formative forces.

original: rgyu gzhan la rag las pas sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin gyi phyir 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal te lha'i 'gro bar gtogs pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan la rag las pas sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin gyi phyir 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal te lha'i 'gro bar gtogs pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The suffering of change is due to the nature of suffering, since it is dependent on other causes. It is that of those belonging to the destiny of the gods.

original: lha'i bde ba yang mthar sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i bde ba yang mthar sdug bsngal gyi rgyu can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Even the happiness of the gods is ultimately a cause of suffering.

original: 'di dag ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi sdug bsngal te ;
analyzed: 'di dag ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi sdug bsngal te ;
translated: These are the sufferings that have the nature of the three kinds of suffering.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis zhi bar byed pa ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi sdug bsngal zhi ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs kyis zhi bar byed pa ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi sdug bsngal zhi ba'o //
translated: The pacification of the suffering of the three kinds of suffering through the power of the perfections of wisdom and method is the pacification of the suffering of the three kinds of suffering.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: gsum sel zhes pa ste sdug bsngal gsum po 'di rnams mthar byed pas na gsum mthar byed do //
analyzed: gsum sel zhes pa ste sdug bsngal gsum po 'di rnams mthar byed pas na gsum mthar byed do //
translated: The pacification of the three is the pacification of the three kinds of suffering, since it brings these three kinds of suffering to an end.

original: yang na snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan gsum dang 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams gsum dang / lus la sogs pa gsum dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan gsum dang 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams gsum dang / lus la sogs pa gsum dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa gsum ste /

original: de rnams yang dag par yongs su shes pas mthar byed pas na gsum sel lo //
analyzed: de rnams yang dag par yongs su shes pas mthar byed pas na gsum sel lo //

analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa'i mtha' med pas na /
translated: Since there is no extreme of eternalism or nihilism, etc. because of non-abiding nirvana itself,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i grol ba dang lhog par grol bas gdul bya'i skye bo rjes su gzung ba'i phyir grol gsum son pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i grol ba dang lhog par grol bas gdul bya'i skye bo rjes su gzung ba'i phyir grol gsum son pa ste /

analyzed: de'i snang ba skyed pa'i phyir rnam par bsgom pa'i byed pas na grol gsum son pa'o //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya dang las kyi sgrib pa rnams dang bral ba'i phyir sgrib pa kun las nges par grol ba'o //

original: de nyid kyi phyir mkha' ltar mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa'o //üîΩde'i phyir bdag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mkha' ltar mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa'o // de'i phyir bdag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad las 'das pa ste /
translated: For that very reason, it abides in the equality of space.üîΩTherefore, it is beyond all the stains of the afflictions of those who are attached to a self.

original: shin tu mnan pas na nyon mongs dri ma kun las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu mnan pas na nyon mongs dri ma kun las 'das pa ste /

analyzed: dus med pa dang dus ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas gsum ste de rnams dus med pa yang ngo //

analyzed: de rnams kyang rtag pa tsam gyi lus nyid kyis don dam par yong ba ma yin pa'i phyir dus med pa'o // de rnams ma rtogs pa nyid @186a * //

translated: Or else, it is like a great nƒÅga, since it is the cause for satisfying all sentient beings with the rain of the nectar of Dharma that removes the torment of their afflictions.

analyzed: sems can kun gyi klu chen po zhes pa ste / yon tan gyi 'jig rten las 'das pa ste de rnams kyi thod ni rgyan no //

analyzed: de gang dag gi yon tan gyi thod yin zhe na ;

original: nyan thos la sogs rnams kyi ste /

translated: It is the crest-jewel of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so forth.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi sku nyid kyis de bzhin rnams kyang thod du byed pas /

translated: it is the crest-jewel of those who have crest-jewels.

translated: The Bhagavat is Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, who is equal to space.

analyzed: lhag ma kun ni 'gro ba drug tu gtogs pa'i nye bar len pa rnams so //
translated: The rest are the appropriated aggregates of the six types of beings.

original: de rnams la chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis nges par grol bas na lhag ma kun las rnam grol zhes so //
analyzed: de rnams la chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis nges par grol bas na lhag ma kun las rnam grol zhes so //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /

analyzed: nam mkha' zhes pa la sogs pa ste gang gi lam na nam mkha'i lam la gnas pa de ni nam mkha'i lam ste mi gnas pa zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: de la legs par gnas pa ni dmigs pa med pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Abiding in that is the meaning of ‚Äúnonreferential.‚ÄùüîΩIf that is so, then since it is nonconceptual like space, how does it benefit sentient beings?

analyzed: gal te de de ltar gyur na nam mkha' bzhin du rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir 'di ji ltar sems can gyi don byed ce na gsungs pa /

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i nus pa ni phyi rol med par gyur pa'i yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i mtshan nyid dang bral bas lhun gyis grub pa nyid kyis 'gro ba mtha' dag gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhir gyur pas na /
translated: The power of the giving and so forth of the omniscient one is the basis of the perfection of the welfare of all transmigrators by way of its spontaneous accomplishment, since it is free from the character of a wish-granting jewel that is not external.

original: yid bzhin nor bu chen po ste byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu chen po ste byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: It is the thought of enlightenment, the great wish-granting jewel.

original: @186b de de'i bdag nyid du 'chang bas na yid bzhin gyi nor bu chen po 'chang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: @186b de de'i bdag nyid du 'chang bas na yid bzhin gyi nor bu chen po 'chang zhes pa'o //
translated: He is called the bearer of the great wish-granting jewel because he holds it in the nature of that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: khyab bdag rin chen kun gyi mchog / dpag bsam shing chen rgyas pa ste //
analyzed: khyab bdag rin chen kun gyi mchog / dpag bsam shing chen rgyas pa ste //
translated: The lord of all jewels, the great wish-granting tree,

original: bum pa bzang po che ba'i mchog / ces pa ste /
analyzed: bum pa bzang po che ba'i mchog / ces pa ste /

original: rin chen kun gyi mchog ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu'o ;
analyzed: rin chen kun gyi mchog ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu'o ;

translated: This verse shows that the spirit of enlightenment is superior to everything else because it has three special qualities, which are indicated by the words ‚Äúpervading,‚Äù etc.

original: de yang yid bzhin gyi nor bu ni rang gi sa phyogs nas brtsams nas dpag tshad stong gi bar du gnas pa rnams kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i don rdzogs par bya bar nus la /
analyzed: de yang yid bzhin gyi nor bu ni rang gi sa phyogs nas brtsams nas dpag tshad stong gi bar du gnas pa rnams kyi mngon par 'dod pa'i don rdzogs par bya bar nus la /
translated: A wish-granting gem can fulfill the wishes of those who live within a thousand leagues of the place where it is located.

original: dpag bsam gyi shing gis kyang rang gi grib ma'i nang du chud pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing gis kyang rang gi grib ma'i nang du chud pa rnams kyi'o //

original: bum pa bzang po yang der lag pa chud pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: bum pa bzang po yang der lag pa chud pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: An excellent vase can do the same for those who place their hands inside it.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyal po ni khams gsum gyi mtha' klas pa'i sems can thams cad dang sangs rgyas nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i sems can gyi don byed pa dang byas pa dang byed par 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyal po ni khams gsum gyi mtha' klas pa'i sems can thams cad dang sangs rgyas nyid kyi mthar thug pa'i sems can gyi don byed pa dang byas pa dang byed par 'gyur ba na /
translated: The king, the spirit of enlightenment, can fulfill the wishes of all sentient beings throughout the three realms, and of those who are on the path to buddhahood, in the past, present, and future.

original: sems can kun don byed pa 'dis dus thams cad du byed pa po nyid du gsung ngo //
analyzed: sems can kun don byed pa 'dis dus thams cad du byed pa po nyid du gsung ngo //
translated: This verse shows that he is the agent at all times, because he acts for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: dus gsum du yang myur du rkyen gyis bsgrub pa'i phyir byed pa po zhes pa 'dis kyang de'i ngang tshul ni byed ba po ste /
analyzed: dus gsum du yang myur du rkyen gyis bsgrub pa'i phyir byed pa po zhes pa 'dis kyang de'i ngang tshul ni byed ba po ste /
translated: This verse shows that he is the agent because he is quickly established by conditions in the three times.üîΩThe last line shows that he is the permanent agent.

original: tshig mtha' mas rtag pa'i byed pa po nyid du gsungs so zhes pa khyad par ro //
analyzed: tshig mtha' mas rtag pa'i byed pa po nyid du gsungs so zhes pa khyad par ro //

original: sngar bshad pa dang ma bshad pa thams cad du tshig gi don ci ltar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa dang ma bshad pa thams cad du tshig gi don ci ltar rtogs par bya ste /

original: de la khyab bdag ni khyad par zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la khyab bdag ni khyad par zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúlord‚Äù means ‚Äúspecial.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: phan 'dod sems can mnyes gshin pa //
analyzed: phan 'dod sems can mnyes gshin pa //
translated: He is the friend of all sentient beings,

original: zhes pa tshig gnyis po 'di dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes pa tshig gnyis po 'di dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bor sbyar te /
translated: These two lines are to be connected as cause and effect.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu la sogs pa rnams ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu la sogs pa rnams ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: Wish-fulfilling jewels and so on are not like that.

original: rang bzhin zhes pa ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes pa ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNature‚Äù means ‚Äúessence.‚Äù

original: sems can kun gyi don byed pa'i byed pa po nyid la sogs pa'i rgyu gsungs pa ;
analyzed: sems can kun gyi don byed pa'i byed pa po nyid la sogs pa'i rgyu gsungs pa ;
translated: The cause of being the agent who acts for the benefit of all sentient beings and so on is stated:

original: dge dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dge dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Virtue, non-virtue, and so on.

original: ma chags pa la sogs pa gsum dang des bskyed pa'i las ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: ma chags pa la sogs pa gsum dang des bskyed pa'i las ni dge ba'o //
translated: The three such as non-attachment and the karma generated by them are virtue.

original: de las bzlog pa ni mi dge ba ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni mi dge ba ste /

original: de gnyis dus gsum pa can ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror bde ba dang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis dus gsum pa can ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror bde ba dang sdug bsngal sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: Those two, which exist in the three times, establish happiness and suffering in happy and miserable rebirths.

original: de rnams thams @187a * //
analyzed: de rnams thams @187a * //
translated: All of those

original: cad du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad kyis shes par mdzad pas na dge dang mi dge shes pa'o //
analyzed: cad du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad kyis shes par mdzad pas na dge dang mi dge shes pa'o //
translated: are known by all sentient beings exactly as they are, so he is the knower of virtue and non-virtue.

original: gdul bya'i skye bo'i sems ji lta ba bzhin mkhyen pas bstan pa dang / btang snyoms dang yongs su rgyal ba mngon sum du bya ba'i dus kyi rnam par dbye ba yongs su mkhyen pas na dus shes pa'o //

translated: He is the knower of time because he knows the minds of disciples exactly as they are, he knows the divisions of time for teaching, equanimity, and manifest victory.

analyzed: dam tshig ni brda ste sems can thams cad kyi skad dang sgra dang gsang ste bshad pa dang glu la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can no //

analyzed: de chos ston pa'i don du mkhyen par mdzad pas na dam tshig shes pa'o //

analyzed: sems can rnams kyi dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams ni rtul po la sogs pa'i dbye bas so sor rnam pa dgu'o //

analyzed: de rnams mkhyen pas ni sems can dbang po shes pa'o //
translated: Since he knows those, he is the knower of the faculties of sentient beings.

original: sems can yongs su shes pa'i dus las ma yol bar 'dul bar mdzad pa'i phyir dus shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su shes pa'i dus las ma yol bar 'dul bar mdzad pa'i phyir dus shes pa'o //
translated: Since he tames sentient beings without missing the time to know sentient beings, he is the knower of time.

original: thung dur yod pa ni gtsug lag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thung dur yod pa ni gtsug lag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since he is short, he is the knower of the scriptures.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rnam par grol ba gsum la nyon mongs pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad du yongs su mkhyen cing mkhas pas na rnam grol gsum la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rnam par grol ba gsum la nyon mongs pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad du yongs su mkhyen cing mkhas pas na rnam grol gsum la mkhas pa'o //
translated: He is skilled in the three liberations of the sravakas, etc. because he fully knows and understands all the aspects of their characteristics, such as freedom from the defilements.

original: yon tan ni stobs bcu la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: yon tan ni stobs bcu la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The qualities are the ten powers, etc.

original: dri ma med par rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pa 'di la mnga' bas na yon tan no //
analyzed: dri ma med par rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs pa 'di la mnga' bas na yon tan no //
translated: He is skilled in the qualities because he has mastery over these stainless, completely perfected qualities.

original: yon tan de rnams kyi rang bzhin dang ldan pa la sogs pa yongs su smin pa'i phyir yon tan shes so //
analyzed: yon tan de rnams kyi rang bzhin dang ldan pa la sogs pa yongs su smin pa'i phyir yon tan shes so //
translated: He is skilled in the qualities because he has fully matured the nature of these qualities, etc.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa la sogs pa chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i tshul gyis mkhyen pas na chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa la sogs pa chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa'i tshul gyis mkhyen pas na chos shes pa'o //
translated: He is skilled in the Dharma because he knows all dharmas, such as the wholesome, unwholesome, undefined, etc. in the manner of illusions, etc.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi sku rnams nyid kyi phyir lha dang lha ma yin dang mi rnams kyi yid du 'ong zhing rab tu bstod pa nyid kyis rab zhi ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi sku rnams nyid kyi phyir lha dang lha ma yin dang mi rnams kyi yid du 'ong zhing rab tu bstod pa nyid kyis rab zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace, because it is the body of merit and knowledge itself, and because it is the peace that comes from being pleasing and highly praised by gods, titans, and men.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'joms shing phun sum tshogs pa 'gugs pa'i rgyu ni bkra shis so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'joms shing phun sum tshogs pa 'gugs pa'i rgyu ni bkra shis so //
translated: Auspiciousness is the cause for destroying adverse factors and attracting excellences.

original: 'di las de 'dra ba dang brjod pa la sogs pa 'byung bas na bkra shis @187b 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di las de 'dra ba dang brjod pa la sogs pa 'byung bas na bkra shis @187b 'byung ngo //
translated: It is the source of auspiciousness, because such things as good fortune come from it.

original: rang nyid bkra shis thams cad kyi bkra shis nyid kyi phyir bkra shis kun gyi bkra shis pa ste /
analyzed: rang nyid bkra shis thams cad kyi bkra shis nyid kyi phyir bkra shis kun gyi bkra shis pa ste /
translated: It is the auspiciousness of all auspiciousness, because it is the auspiciousness of all things auspicious.

original: rang gi don la de phan gyi rkyen byin pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi don la de phan gyi rkyen byin pa ste /
translated: It is glory, because it is the cause for the attainment of one's own aim.

original: skye bo'i tshogs gzhan rnams la bsod nams skye ba'i rgyur gyur ba'i yang dag par brjod pa'i ngo bo de nyid ni grags pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo'i tshogs gzhan rnams la bsod nams skye ba'i rgyur gyur ba'i yang dag par brjod pa'i ngo bo de nyid ni grags pa'o //
translated: It is fame, because it is the cause for the production of merit in the multitude of other beings, and because it is the essence of true expression.

original: gzhan rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / rang nyid phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dpal mo'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / rang nyid phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dpal mo'o //
translated: He is Sri, prosperity, because he is the cause of the prosperity of others and because he is the nature of his own prosperity.

original: de bzhin du rang dang gzhan gyi sde rnams la bsod nams rab tu skye zhing legs pa 'byung ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das de nyid snyan grags so ;üîΩ/ sngar / grags chen snyan grags chan po ste //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang dang gzhan gyi sde rnams la bsod nams rab tu skye zhing legs pa 'byung ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das de nyid snyan grags so ; / sngar / grags chen snyan grags chan po ste //
translated: In the same way, he is Bhaga, fame, because he is the nature of the arising of the best merit and the occurrence of the best for his own and others' communities.

original: zhes pa ni rgyu'i tshul gyi sa yin la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rgyu'i tshul gyi sa yin la /
translated: The former verse, Greatly renowned, of great fame, is from the point of view of the cause.

original: 'di ni 'bras bu'i tshul gyis ste mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i tshul gyi khyad par ro //üîΩde'i phyir yon tan thams cad kyi 'od zer gyis gsal bas srid pa gsum gyi khongs su mdzes pas sam ;
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu'i tshul gyis ste mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i tshul gyi khyad par ro // de'i phyir yon tan thams cad kyi 'od zer gyis gsal bas srid pa gsum gyi khongs su mdzes pas sam ;
translated: This verse is from the point of view of the result, a special way of reciting the epithets.

original: yang na sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rgyur gyur pas na dge ba'o //
analyzed: yang na sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rgyur gyur pas na dge ba'o //
translated: Therefore, he is Sugata, Well-Gone, because he is beautiful in the three worlds by the radiance of all good qualities, or because he is the cause of the virtue of all sentient beings.

original: mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i chos ston pa nyid kyis sems can thams cad la dga' ston chen po'i dga' ba 'di las 'phel ba'i phyir dang / rang nyid kyang khams gsum pa'i dga' ston chen po'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir dga' ston chen po'o //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i chos ston pa nyid kyis sems can thams cad la dga' ston chen po'i dga' ba 'di las 'phel ba'i phyir dang / rang nyid kyang khams gsum pa'i dga' ston chen po'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir dga' ston chen po'o //
translated: It is a great festival because it increases the joy of all sentient beings through teaching the Dharma of high status and certain goodness, and because it is the nature of the great festival of the three realms.

original: skrag pa thams cad dang bral ba nyid ni dbugs 'byin thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skrag pa thams cad dang bral ba nyid ni dbugs 'byin thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is the attainment of relief because it is free from all fear.

original: gang gi phyir sems can thams cad la dbugs 'byin chen po mdzad cing rang nyid kyang de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir dbugs 'byin chen po'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can thams cad la dbugs 'byin chen po mdzad cing rang nyid kyang de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i phyir dbugs 'byin chen po'o //
translated: It is a great relief because it gives great relief to all sentient beings and because it is the nature of that.

original: de lta bu ni dga' ba chen po dang 'dod chags chen po'i rang bzhin gyi phyir rol mo chen po'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni dga' ba chen po dang 'dod chags chen po'i rang bzhin gyi phyir rol mo chen po'o //
translated: It is a great performance because it is the nature of great joy and great passion.

original: bkur sti ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis dam par byed cing mchod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bkur sti ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis dam par byed cing mchod par byed pa ste /
translated: It is worship because the world with its gods, humans, and asuras honors it and makes offerings to it.

original: rang nyid kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la bkur sti mdzad pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rim gro'o //
analyzed: rang nyid kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la bkur sti mdzad pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rim gro'o //
translated: He is the one who honors all the Tathagatas, and he is the one who is honored by all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad 'byor ba thams cad kyi rgyu'i phyir dang rang nyid kyang bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi bdag nyid can gyi phyir phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'byor ba thams cad kyi rgyu'i phyir dang rang nyid kyang bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi bdag nyid can gyi phyir phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: He is the one who is endowed with all the causes of all the enjoyments of all sentient beings, and he is the one who is endowed with the accumulation of merit.

original: phul du byung ba'i dga' ba dang mgu ba rab tu dga' ba dang de'i rgyu'i phyir dang / rang nyid kyang de'i rang @188a * //üîΩbzhin yin pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: phul du byung ba'i dga' ba dang mgu ba rab tu dga' ba dang de'i rgyu'i phyir dang / rang nyid kyang de'i rang @188a * // bzhin yin pa'i phyir rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: He is the one who is endowed with the cause of the highest joy and delight, and he is the one who is endowed with the nature of that joy and delight.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir dang de'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dpal lo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir dang de'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir dpal lo //
translated: He is the one who is endowed with the accumulation of wisdom, and he is the one who is endowed with the cause of that.

original: sems can rnams la bdag nyid kyi dpal lo //
analyzed: sems can rnams la bdag nyid kyi dpal lo //
translated: He is the one who is endowed with his own glory, and he is the one who is endowed with the glory of all sentient beings.

original: zhing spel ba'i phyir grags pa'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: zhing spel ba'i phyir grags pa'i bdag po'o //
translated: He is the one who is endowed with the cause of the increase of the field, and he is the one who is endowed with the cause of the increase of his own glory.

original: rnam pa thams cad rnams dag pa'i yon tan gyi lus can nyid kyi phyir mchog ni sangs rgyas de nyid ldan pas mchog ldan no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rnams dag pa'i yon tan gyi lus can nyid kyi phyir mchog ni sangs rgyas de nyid ldan pas mchog ldan no //
translated: Since he is endowed with the body of virtues, which is pure in every way, he is supreme. Since he is endowed with that supreme state, he is supreme.

original: mchog mngon par 'dod cing don du gnyer ba'i sems can rnams la sbyin par byed pas na mchog sbyin no //
analyzed: mchog mngon par 'dod cing don du gnyer ba'i sems can rnams la sbyin par byed pas na mchog sbyin no //
translated: He is the bestower of the supreme, since he bestows the supreme upon beings who desire and seek the supreme.

original: mchog sbyin pa po thams cad las phul du byung ba'i phyir gtso bo'o //
analyzed: mchog sbyin pa po thams cad las phul du byung ba'i phyir gtso bo'o //
translated: He is the chief, since he is the foremost of all bestowers of the supreme.

original: 'khor bas 'jigs pa'i sems can thams cad 'jigs pa las srung bas na skyabs 'os so //
analyzed: 'khor bas 'jigs pa'i sems can thams cad 'jigs pa las srung bas na skyabs 'os so //
translated: He is the worthy refuge, since he protects all beings who fear samsara from fear.

original: mchog ces pa 'dir yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mchog ces pa 'dir yang sbyar ro //
translated: The word supreme is also to be supplied here.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad las 'das pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la sems can thams cad rab tu 'jog pa nas skyabs kyi dam pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad las 'das pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la sems can thams cad rab tu 'jog pa nas skyabs kyi dam pa'o //
translated: He is the highest refuge, since he establishes all beings in the nondwelling nirvana, which is the transcendence of all fears.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: 'jig chen dgra ste rab kyi mchog / ces pa la bdud bzhi rnams ni 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig chen dgra ste rab kyi mchog / ces pa la bdud bzhi rnams ni 'jigs pa'o //
translated: he is the enemy of the great fear, the supreme. The four demons are the fears.

original: 'jigs pa chen po de rnams kyi dgra ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'jigs pa chen po de rnams kyi dgra ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The enemies of those great fears are the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi rab mchog ste bag chags kyi 'jug pa thams cad kun du bcom pas so //üîΩde'i phyir / 'jigs pa ma lus sel ba po //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rab mchog ste bag chags kyi 'jug pa thams cad kun du bcom pas so // de'i phyir / 'jigs pa ma lus sel ba po //
translated: He is the best of them, because he has completely destroyed all the propensities to engage in them.

original: zhes pa'o / //
analyzed: zhes pa'o / //
translated: Therefore, he is the one who removes all fears without exception.

original: / da ni mu stegs pas yongs su brtags pa'i cha byad kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / da ni mu stegs pas yongs su brtags pa'i cha byad kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /

analyzed: de'i brtul zhugs kyi ming don gyi sgo nas yang dag par brjod pas gsungs pa /

analyzed: gtsug phud ces pa la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: munydza ni 'di'i brtul zhugs mgo @188b zlum yin pas te /

analyzed: kun du rgyu'i rtags de 'di la mnga' bas na munydza'o //
translated: He is called ‚Äúhaving matted hair‚Äù because he has that mark of a wandering ascetic.

analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan cing spyod pa na rtse bran 'chang ba'i lha'i bu'i brtul zhugs 'chang ba'i phyir cod pan thogs pa'o //

analyzed: lam gyi yan lag brgyad ni 'di'i yan lag rnams ni brgyad yin pa ste sngar bshad zin to /

original: // / gdul bya'i skye bo'i rgyud la dmigs pa de 'dren par byed cing thabs gang gis de'i tshul gang rig pa de ni lam gyi yan lag brgyad tshul rig pa'o //

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

analyzed: yang dag sangs rgyas lam rig pa //

translated: He is greatly attached to all beings because of his great compassion, which is not limited to establishing all beings in the nirvana in which there is no remainder of the aggregates.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nam mkha' lta bu'o //

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems @202a * //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems @202a * //

translated: It penetrates the minds of all sentient beings because it realizes their sameness.üîΩIt is swift as thought because it possesses the samadhi that is swift as thought, in order to teach the Dharma that penetrates the minds of all disciples simultaneously and very quickly, in accordance with their fortune, without transgressing the thought of taming disciples, since its meaning is the realization of the purpose of migrating beings.

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mnga' ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sems can kun gyi yid ltar mgyogs zhes bya'o //

original: sems can rnams kyi dbang bo rnams ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi dbang bo rnams ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ste /

analyzed: @203a * // bden bzhi'i tshul dang 'dra ba yi // shes pa brgyad po'i rtogs pa 'chang //

original: de nyid 'jig rten las 'das ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid 'jig rten las 'das ba ste /

original: chen po brnyes pa'i phyir rdzu 'phrul chen po'o //üîΩthos ba dang bsam pa dang bsgom ba'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par brtson pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa brnyes pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu

original: phyin pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: phyin pa'i mtha'o //

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa'o /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa'o /

original: shes rab ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab ces pa la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: shes rab kyi de kho na nyid ni shin tu dri ma med pa'i de bzhin nyid do //

analyzed: rang gi rgyud dang tha mi dad pa'i so so rang rig pa'i chos nyid yongs su shes pa'i phyir bdag rig go //

analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i rang gi sems dang tha mi dad pa nyid kyis gzhan rnams la go bar byed pas na gzhan rig go //

analyzed: de ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes sna tshogs gzugs can nyid kyis de lta de ltar snang ba'i phyir /

analyzed: de nyid thams cad pa ste sna tshogs gzugs can yin pa'i phyir rdo rje 'chang ba zhes pa'i don to //

analyzed: sarbba zhes klog pa ni rang gi don can gyi aan rkyen du byin pa'o //

analyzed: sems can thams cad la mtha' gcig tu phan pa'i phyir kun la phan pa'o //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad kyi gtso bo'i skyes bu nyid kyi phyir gang zag mchog go //

analyzed: de bzhi nyid kyi bdag nyid phyir gyis de dang 'dra ba cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir dper bya kun las 'das pa'o //

analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi de kho na nyid kyi ye shes 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pas na ye shes kyi bdag po'o //

analyzed: phul du byung ba'i phyir mchog ste rje btsun 'jam dpal lo //
translated: It is supreme because it is the best, that is, it is the venerable Manjusri.

analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa ni sbyin pa thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir chos kyi sbyin bdag gtso bo'o//

original: phyag rgya bzhi zhes pa la sogs pa la phyag rgya bzhi ni /
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi zhes pa la sogs pa la phyag rgya bzhi ni /

analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub ni de nyid de /

analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir sangs rgyas byang chub bo //
translated: The enlightenment of the buddhas is the nature of the intuition of the knowledge of destruction and nonproduction.

translated: Although there is no distinction between the buddhas and enlightenment, the enlightenment of the buddhas is mentioned because of the distinction of the buddhas.

analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir sangs rgyas 'dod pa'o //
translated: The delight of the buddhas is the delight of the buddhas because it is the cause of the mental satisfaction of the buddhas.

translated: Or else, the desire of the buddhas is the desire of the buddhas because it is the desire of all buddhas to perform the deeds of a buddha.

analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas rnams kyi yid bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir sangs rgyas dgyes pa'o //
translated: The delight of the buddhas is the delight of the buddhas because it is the cause of the mental satisfaction of the buddhas.

analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'dzum pa ni bzhad pa'i rgyu can te sems can gyi don gyi rkyen gyis so //

original: de rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa'i mig dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam spong ba ston pa'i phyir mi skye bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa'i mig dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam spong ba ston pa'i phyir mi skye bar byed pa'o //
translated: The eye that is the cause of those is the path of the ten virtuous actions. In order to show the abandonment of that, it says to make it not arise.

original: 'phrog byed dang lag ldan la sogs pa brgyad ni 'jigs pa chen po rnams te /
analyzed: 'phrog byed dang lag ldan la sogs pa brgyad ni 'jigs pa chen po rnams te /
translated: The eight beginning with the grabbers and the armed ones are the great fears.

original: de dag gi btab pa rnams 'di dran pa tsam gyis nye bar zhi bar byed pa la sogs pa phal cher ni rtogs par sla'o //
analyzed: de dag gi btab pa rnams 'di dran pa tsam gyis nye bar zhi bar byed pa la sogs pa phal cher ni rtogs par sla'o //
translated: The taming of those is the pacification of them by merely remembering this mantra. Most of the rest is easy to understand.

original: de ltar na yang cung zad rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yang cung zad rnam par dbye bar bya ste /
translated: Nevertheless, I will analyze it a little.

original: mig g-yon 'gul ba la sogs pa ni mtshan ma ngan pa'o //
analyzed: mig g-yon 'gul ba la sogs pa ni mtshan ma ngan pa'o //
translated: The trembling of the left eye and so forth are bad omens.

original: sdug bsngal mtshon par byed pa'i ce spyang sgra sogs pa la sogs pa ni lhags ngan pa dang / de nyid bgegs te de nye bar zhi ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mtshon par byed pa'i ce spyang sgra sogs pa la sogs pa ni lhags ngan pa dang / de nyid bgegs te de nye bar zhi ba byed pa'o //
translated: The howling of jackals and so forth that indicate suffering are bad dreams, and that itself is an obstacle. To pacify is to make it not arise.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid mngon du byas nas bklags pas bdud dang dgra'i las thams cad ring du spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid mngon du byas nas bklags pas bdud dang dgra'i las thams cad ring du spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: Having actualized the emptiness of all phenomena, by reciting it one abandons all the activities of Mara and enemies.

original: rang gi sems nges bar sbyong pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams te de rnams ni bsod nams nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi sems nges bar sbyong pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams te de rnams ni bsod nams nyid do //
translated: The roots of virtue are nonattachment, nonhatred, and nondelusion, because they are the causes for purifying one's mind.

original: de nye bar sogs pa ni klog pa dang / kha ton la sogs pa dang rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nye bar sogs pa ni klog pa dang / kha ton la sogs pa dang rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are merit, because they increase by reading, reciting, and so on.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni bdag dang bdag gi ba la sogs par mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba'i de kho na nyid ma yin pa yid la byed pa ste de mi skye bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni bdag dang bdag gi ba la sogs par mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba'i de kho na nyid ma yin pa yid la byed pa ste de mi skye bar byed pa ni /
translated: Improper mental attention is mental attention to what is not reality, preceded by adherence to a self, entities connected with a self, and so on.

original: chos thams cad bdag med ba la sems rtse gcig tu gsal ba nyid kyis bklags pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med ba la sems rtse gcig tu gsal ba nyid kyis bklags pa'o //
translated: It is eliminated by the clarity of the mind's single focus on the selflessness of all things.

original: rigs dang nor dang rig pa la sogs pa @215b rnams kyis sems mtho bar gyur pa ni rgyags pa'o //
analyzed: rigs dang nor dang rig pa la sogs pa @215b rnams kyis sems mtho bar gyur pa ni rgyags pa'o //
translated: Arrogance is the elevation of the mind due to one's family, wealth, learning, and so on.

original: na ti s'a dbye po dngos po la sems mtho ba ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: na ti s'a dbye po dngos po la sems mtho ba ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: Pride is the elevation of the mind due to things.

original: ma se mo gzhan ma yin zhes so //
analyzed: ma se mo gzhan ma yin zhes so //
translated: It is not a different one.

original: khengs pa ni dregs pa'o //
analyzed: khengs pa ni dregs pa'o //
translated: Arrogance is haughtiness.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa rnams skyon rnams kyi rtsa ba ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa rnams skyon rnams kyi rtsa ba ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The root of all these faults is the belief in self.

original: 'di rnams thams cad sel bar byed pa ni rang bzhin med par khong du chud pas so //
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad sel bar byed pa ni rang bzhin med par khong du chud pas so //
translated: The removal of all these faults is through the realization of the absence of self-existence.

original: sdug bsngal ni lus kyi'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni lus kyi'o //
translated: Pain is physical.

original: yid mi bde ba ni sems kyi'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni sems kyi'o //
translated: Sorrow is mental.

original: sdug bsngal de dag mi skye bar byed pa ni chos kyi de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i dga' ba'i dga' ston gyi zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de dag mi skye bar byed pa ni chos kyi de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i dga' ba'i dga' ston gyi zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The removal of these is through the suppression of the pain and sorrow by the feast of joy which comes from the realization of the truth of things.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po ni stong pa nyid yi ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po ni stong pa nyid yi ye shes so //
translated: The essence of all the Tathagatas is the knowledge of voidness.

original: der gyur pa ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo'i don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: der gyur pa ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo'i don gyi phyir ro //
translated: It is so because it is the meaning of the knowledge of voidness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gsang bar gyur ba ni skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i sems can rnams la sbas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gsang bar gyur ba ni skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i sems can rnams la sbas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the secret of the Bodhisattvas because it is hidden from those who are not fit vessels.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsang chen du gyur pa ni /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsang chen du gyur pa ni /
translated: It is the great secret of all the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: de rnams kyang mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i don sgom par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams kyang mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i don sgom par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: because they meditate on the meaning of the Praises of the Praiseworthy.

original: de lta bu'i rang gi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang gi yon tan phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of one's own abundant good qualities.

original: phyag rgya thams cad ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: phyag rgya thams cad ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: All the seals have been explained previously.

original: sngags thams cad ni snying po dang nye ba'i snying po dang phreng ba'i sngags la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sngags thams cad ni snying po dang nye ba'i snying po dang phreng ba'i sngags la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: All the mantras are the essence mantras, the near essence mantras, the garland mantras, and so forth.

original: der gyur pa ni de'i rang bzhin te mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: der gyur pa ni de'i rang bzhin te mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'o //
translated: That is their nature, which is the Praises of the Praiseworthy.

original: phyag rgya dang sngags thams cad kyi don mthar phyin ba rtogs pa'i rgyur gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyag rgya dang sngags thams cad kyi don mthar phyin ba rtogs pa'i rgyur gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the cause for realizing the perfection of the meaning of all the seals and mantras,

original: 'di nyid phyag rgya dang sngags thams cad du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid phyag rgya dang sngags thams cad du gyur pa'o //
translated: it is itself all the seals and mantras.

analyzed: chos thams cad brjod du med par smra bar byed pas na de smra ba rnams so //
translated: Because it causes the expression of all phenomena as inexpressible, it is the expression of all.

original: de rnams kyi dran pa ni chos nyid la dmigs pa'i shes rab rtsol ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dran pa ni chos nyid la dmigs pa'i shes rab rtsol ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Their mindfulness is the wisdom that focuses on reality and is accompanied by effort.

original: dran pas gzhag pa'i don rnams bstan par bya ba'i phyir so sor rtog par byed pa ni shes bzhin te de dag yang dag par skyed pa'o //
analyzed: dran pas gzhag pa'i don rnams bstan par bya ba'i phyir so sor rtog par byed pa ni shes bzhin te de dag yang dag par skyed pa'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate the objects that are established by mindfulness, one should generate full awareness, which is the discernment of those objects.

original: shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i bdag nyid can gyi nges par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i bdag nyid can gyi nges par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is the discernment that has the nature of the discernment of all things.

original: yid gzhungs pa ni gzungs dang ldan pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: yid gzhungs pa ni gzungs dang ldan pa'i blo'o //
translated: Intellect is the mind that possesses retention.

original: de dag bla na med pa sgrub par byed pas na bla na med pa'i shes rab dang yid gzhungs par byed pa'o //üîΩlus dang ngag dang sems la gnod pa sel bar byed pa'i nus pa phul @216a * //

translated: Since they cause the attainment of the unsurpassed, they are the cause of unsurpassed wisdom and intellect.

original: du byung ba skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir nad med pa dang stobs so //
analyzed: du byung ba skyed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir nad med pa dang stobs so //
translated: They are the cause of health and strength, because they generate the nature of the capacity to remove harm to body, speech, and mind.

original: dbang phyug ni phra ba dang / yang ba dang / mchod par bya ba dang / bdag por gyur pa dang / 'dod dgur ldan pa dang / dbang phyug tu gyur pa dang / gar yang phyin pa dang / dga' mgur gnas pa zhes pa ste rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: dbang phyug ni phra ba dang / yang ba dang / mchod par bya ba dang / bdag por gyur pa dang / 'dod dgur ldan pa dang / dbang phyug tu gyur pa dang / gar yang phyin pa dang / dga' mgur gnas pa zhes pa ste rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: The eightfold mastery is mastery over: subtlety, lightness, worship, sovereignty, possession of what one desires, lordship, going everywhere, and abiding in bliss.

original: yang na bdud thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba'i mnga' bdag nyid ni dbang phyug go //
analyzed: yang na bdud thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba'i mnga' bdag nyid ni dbang phyug go //
translated: Or else, mastery is the state of being the lord who has conquered all demons.

original: de dag phun sum tshogs par byed pa ni rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag phun sum tshogs par byed pa ni rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The perfection of those is the completion of those.

original: dpal dang dge ba zhes pa ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag go //
analyzed: dpal dang dge ba zhes pa ni rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dag go //
translated: Glory and virtue are the accumulations of merit and wisdom, respectively.

original: zhi ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad ldog pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad ldog pa'o //
translated: Peace is the cessation of all afflictions and secondary afflictions.

original: legs pa ni sangs rgyas nyid de dag rab tu 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: legs pa ni sangs rgyas nyid de dag rab tu 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: Well-being is buddhahood, which causes their increase.

original: ye shes dang sbyin pa dag phul du byung bas rim ba bzhin du snyan pa dang grags pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang sbyin pa dag phul du byung bas rim ba bzhin du snyan pa dang grags pa'o //

analyzed: yon tan thams cad phul du phyin pas tshigs su bcad pa'o //

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du dam par gyur pa'i yon tan rab tu gsal ba ni bstod pa'o //

original: shin tu dag pa ni rang nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu dag pa ni rang nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is very pure, because it is itself very pure.

original: shin tu gtsang gnas ni gzhan te gtsang bar byed pa ba zhes sbyar te gtsang ldan no //
analyzed: shin tu gtsang gnas ni gzhan te gtsang bar byed pa ba zhes sbyar te gtsang ldan no //

original: skyabs ni ngan song gsum las yang dag par srung ba'o //
analyzed: skyabs ni ngan song gsum las yang dag par srung ba'o //
translated: It is a refuge, because it protects from the three miserable realms.

original: nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad dang bral ba'i gnas ni 'dir gnas te /
analyzed: nye bar 'tshe ba thams cad dang bral ba'i gnas ni 'dir gnas te /
translated: It is an abode, because it is free from all violence.

original: de yang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //

original: gang rnams kyi zhe na gnas 'dod pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gang rnams kyi zhe na gnas 'dod pa rnams kyi'o //

original: skyob pa ni glo bur du thog 'bab pa la sogs pa zlog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: skyob pa ni glo bur du thog 'bab pa la sogs pa zlog par byed pa ste /
translated: It is a protector, because it wards off sudden lightning strikes, etc.

original: rtag par klog pa dang kha ton byas pa las so //
analyzed: rtag par klog pa dang kha ton byas pa las so //

original: dpung gnyen ni ma zhen pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: dpung gnyen ni ma zhen pa'i gnas te /
translated: It is a friend, because it is the abode of non-dejection.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dpung gnyen med pa rnams ni thar pa'i lam ma thob pa rnams so //

analyzed: gling du gyur pa ni 'khor ba'i rgyu mtshor lhung ba rnams kyi ngal so ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gnas med pa rnams ni lam dang lam ma yin pa yongs su shes pa la rmongs pa rnams so //

analyzed: lam yang dag pa sgrub pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir gnas bla na med par gyur pa'o //
